result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Palmore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 140 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
No contact with athe victim/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: filed by Department of Corrections requesting clarification of the Judgment of Conviction.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: May 29, 2015 filed by Joni Smith, court reporter.

Defendant Michael D Palmore in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called. Court imposed the following sentence as to count 1. 

Total sentence:  10 years (Initial Confinement: 4  years, Extended Supervision: 6  years) 
 Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
 Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
 Court costs of $268.00 and $250 DNA Surcharge  to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
 Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
 Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken in the manner they were prescribed. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any Mental Health treatment/counseling recommended by agent. 
No contact with the victim/business listed in the criminal complaint. 
140 days credit already served
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Palmore in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a plea of guilty as to count 1 and strike the repeater allegation. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Matter adjourned for sentencing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Preliminary and Arraignment held on February 12, 2015. Transcript maintained in file 15CF21.
Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael D Palmore in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Attorney Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for preliminary hearing. City of Waukesha Police officer Ryan LaFavor sworn and testified on direct by Attorney Hirt.  Exhibit # 1 & 2 marked. Exhibit #1 offered and received.  Cross examination by Attorney Mitchell.  Redirect.  Recross.  Exhibit # 2 not offered and returned.  Attorney Hirt makes closing statements and moves for bind over.  Attorney Mitchell objects and moves to dismiss.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
